summary: This is a Freedom of Information Act (FOIA) request submitted by Kevina Tidwell, an archival producer for Blue Ant Media, to the Department of Justice. The request seeks records related to the federal cases against Ghislaine Maxwell and Jeffrey Epstein, including audio, video, photographic, and transcript records concerning victims, witnesses, investigations, and the defendants themselves. The requester asks for expedited processing based on news media status.

persons.name: Ghislaine Noelle Marion Maxwell
persons.context: The subject of the FOIA request, identified as a defendant in two federal cases in the Southern District of New York, currently incarcerated.

persons.name: Jeffrey Edward Epstein
persons.context: The co-subject of the FOIA request, identified as deceased, with records pertaining to his case and alleged crimes being sought.

persons.name: Kevina Tidwell
persons.context: The individual submitting the FOIA request on behalf of Blue Ant Media, seeking records for documentary production.

connections.description: The FOIA request seeks records pertaining to both individuals and their joint activities, indicating their legal and operational connection in the referenced cases.

events.title: Death of Jeffrey Epstein
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein died while in custody at the federal Metropolitan Correctional Center in New York.

locations: United States District Court, Southern District Of New York
Metropolitan Detention Center, Brooklyn, New York
keyFacts: The document is a formal FOIA request targeting all audio, video, photographic, and transcript records from the federal investigations and prosecutions of Ghislaine Maxwell and Jeffrey Epstein.
The request specifically seeks records of 911 calls, interviews with victims and their families, witness conversations, surveillance materials, and any recordings of Epstein or Maxwell.
The requester, Kevina Tidwell, identifies as a news media archival producer and requests expedited processing, citing the high public importance of the case.
Ghislaine Maxwell is noted as being held at the Metropolitan Detention Center in Brooklyn, and Jeffrey Epstein's death in custody on August 10, 2019, is referenced.
